sentence: Former U.S. Rep. Lou Barletta, a leading contender for the GOP nomination in the Pennsylvania governor’s race, is hoisting up the economic impacts of Russia’s invasion into Ukraine as a portrait of why American energy independence is so important.
author: Julian Routh
title: GOP governor candidate Lou Barletta says Pennsylvania could lead the way for U.S. energy independence

sentence: Former Congressman Lou Barletta and State Senator Doug Mastriano were separated by one point in the poll with Barletta in the lead at 19%.
author: George Stockburger
title: Jason Richey, Republican candidate for Pennsylvania Governor, drops out; AP

sentence: State Senator Doug Mastriano received 16.2%, followed by Lou Barletta at 12.4% and Bill McSwain at 6.4%.
author: George Stockburger
title: Lebanon County GOP endorses White for Governor

sentence: Corman’s withdrawal still would have left eight Republican candidates vying for the party’s nomination, including McSwain, former U.S. Rep. Lou Barletta, state Sen. Doug Mastriano and former Delaware County Councilman Dave White.
author: The Philadelphia Inquirer
title: Jake Corman is staying in the Republican race for Pennsylvania governor after moving to drop out
